title: Biden to Nominate Jerome Powell for Second Term as Federal Reserve Chairman
sub_head: Reappointment signals policy continuity with central bank leader who remains popular among lawmakers; Lael Brainard to be nominated as vice chairwoman
body:
President Biden said he would nominate Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell to a second term leading the central bank, opting for continuity in U.S. economic policy despite pushback from some Democrats who wanted someone tougher on bank regulations and climate change.
Mr. Biden said he would also nominate Fed governor Lael Brainard as vice chairwoman of the central bankâ€™s board of governors. Prominent liberals like Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D., Mass.) had warned the president against picking Mr. Powell, and progressive groups mounted a last-ditch campaign to pressure the president to tap Ms. Brainard for the top job.
